trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement iOS SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement iOS SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for iOS SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to Integrate Engagement on iOS
trans-unit.target: How to Integrate Engagement on iOS

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Windows Universal
trans-unit.target: Windows Universal

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone Silverlight
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone Silverlight

trans-unit.source: iOS
trans-unit.target: iOS

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your iOS application.
trans-unit.target: This procedure describes the simplest way to activate Engagement's Analytics and Monitoring functions in your iOS application.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Engagement SDK requires iOS6+: the deployment target of your application must be at least iOS 6.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The Engagement SDK requires iOS6+: the deployment target of your application must be at least iOS 6.

trans-unit.source: The following steps are enough to activate the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.
trans-unit.target: The following steps are enough to activate the report of logs needed to compute all statistics regarding Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technicals.

trans-unit.source: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your iOS app](mobile-engagement-ios-use-engagement-api.md) since these statistics are application dependent.
trans-unit.target: The report of logs needed to compute other statistics like Events, Errors and Jobs must be done manually using the Engagement API (see [How to use the advanced Mobile Engagement tagging API in your iOS app](mobile-engagement-ios-use-engagement-api.md) since these statistics are application dependent.

trans-unit.source: Embed the Engagement SDK into your iOS project
trans-unit.target: Embed the Engagement SDK into your iOS project

trans-unit.source: Add the Engagement SDK to your iOS project: in Xcode, right click on your project and select **"Add files to ..."** and choose the `EngagementSDK` folder.
trans-unit.target: Add the Engagement SDK to your iOS project: in Xcode, right click on your project and select **"Add files to ..."** and choose the `EngagementSDK` folder.

trans-unit.source: Engagement requires additional frameworks to work: in the project explorer, open your project pane and select the correct target.
trans-unit.target: Engagement requires additional frameworks to work: in the project explorer, open your project pane and select the correct target.

trans-unit.source: Then, open the **"Build phases"** tab and in the **"Link Binary With Libraries"** menu, add these frameworks:
trans-unit.target: Then, open the **"Build phases"** tab and in the **"Link Binary With Libraries"** menu, add these frameworks:

trans-unit.source: `AdSupport.framework` - set the link as `Optional`
trans-unit.target: `AdSupport.framework` - set the link as `Optional`

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The AdSupport framework can be removed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The AdSupport framework can be removed.

trans-unit.source: Engagement needs this framework to collect the IDFA.
trans-unit.target: Engagement needs this framework to collect the IDFA.

trans-unit.source: However, IDFA collection can be disabled \<ios-sdk-engagement-idfa\> to comply with the new Apple policy regarding this ID.
trans-unit.target: However, IDFA collection can be disabled \<ios-sdk-engagement-idfa\> to comply with the new Apple policy regarding this ID.

trans-unit.target: Initialize the Engagement SDK

trans-unit.source: You need to modify your Application Delegate:
trans-unit.target: You need to modify your Application Delegate:

trans-unit.target: At the top of your implementation file, import the Engagement agent:

trans-unit.target: Initialize Engagement inside the method '**applicationDidFinishLaunching:**' or '**application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:**':

trans-unit.source: Basic reporting
trans-unit.target: Basic reporting

trans-unit.source: Recommended method: overload your `UIViewController` classes
trans-unit.target: Recommended method: overload your `UIViewController` classes

trans-unit.source: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you can simply make all your `UIViewController` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementViewController` classes (same rule for `UITableViewController` -\> `EngagementTableViewController`).
trans-unit.target: In order to activate the report of all the logs required by Engagement to compute Users, Sessions, Activities, Crashes and Technical statistics, you can simply make all your `UIViewController` sub-classes inherit from the `EngagementViewController` classes (same rule for `UITableViewController` -\> `EngagementTableViewController`).

trans-unit.source: Without Engagement :
trans-unit.target: Without Engagement :

trans-unit.source: With Engagement :
trans-unit.target: With Engagement :

trans-unit.source: Alternate method: call `startActivity()` manually
trans-unit.target: Alternate method: call `startActivity()` manually

trans-unit.source: If you cannot or do not want to overload your `UIViewController` classes, you can instead start your activities by calling `EngagementAgent`'s methods directly.
trans-unit.target: If you cannot or do not want to overload your `UIViewController` classes, you can instead start your activities by calling `EngagementAgent`'s methods directly.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The iOS SDK automatically calls the `endActivity()` method when the application is closed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The iOS SDK automatically calls the `endActivity()` method when the application is closed.

trans-unit.source: Thus, it is *HIGHLY* recommended to call the `startActivity` method whenever the activity of the user change, and to *NEVER* call the `endActivity` method, since calling this method forces the current session to be ended.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it is *HIGHLY* recommended to call the `startActivity` method whenever the activity of the user change, and to *NEVER* call the `endActivity` method, since calling this method forces the current session to be ended.

trans-unit.source: Location reporting
trans-unit.target: Location reporting

trans-unit.source: Apple terms of service do not allow applications to use location tracking for statistics purpose only.
trans-unit.target: Apple terms of service do not allow applications to use location tracking for statistics purpose only.

trans-unit.source: Thus, it is recommended to enable location reports only if your application also use the location tracking for another reason.
trans-unit.target: Thus, it is recommended to enable location reports only if your application also use the location tracking for another reason.

trans-unit.source: Starting with iOS 8, you must provide a description for how your app uses location services by setting a string for the key [NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription] or [NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription] in your app's Info.plist file.
trans-unit.target: Starting with iOS 8, you must provide a description for how your app uses location services by setting a string for the key [NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription] or [NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription] in your app's Info.plist file.

trans-unit.source: If you want to report location in the background with Engagement, add the key NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription.
trans-unit.target: If you want to report location in the background with Engagement, add the key NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription.

trans-unit.source: In all other cases, add the key NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription.
trans-unit.target: In all other cases, add the key NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription.

trans-unit.source: Lazy area location reporting
trans-unit.target: Lazy area location reporting

trans-unit.source: Lazy area location reporting allows to report the country, region and locality associated to devices.
trans-unit.target: Lazy area location reporting allows to report the country, region and locality associated to devices.

trans-unit.source: This type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI).
trans-unit.target: This type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI).

trans-unit.source: The device area is reported at most once per session.
trans-unit.target: The device area is reported at most once per session.

trans-unit.source: The GPS is never used, and thus this type of location report has very few (not to say no) impact on the battery.
trans-unit.target: The GPS is never used, and thus this type of location report has very few (not to say no) impact on the battery.

trans-unit.source: Reported areas are used to compute geographic statistics about users, sessions, events and errors.
trans-unit.target: Reported areas are used to compute geographic statistics about users, sessions, events and errors.

trans-unit.source: They can also be used as criterion in Reach campaigns.
trans-unit.target: They can also be used as criterion in Reach campaigns.

trans-unit.source: The last known area reported for a device can be retrieved thanks to the [Device API].
trans-unit.target: The last known area reported for a device can be retrieved thanks to the [Device API].

trans-unit.source: To enable lazy area location reporting, add the following line after initializing the Engagement agent:
trans-unit.target: To enable lazy area location reporting, add the following line after initializing the Engagement agent:

trans-unit.source: Real time location reporting
trans-unit.target: Real time location reporting

trans-unit.source: Real time location reporting allows to report the latitude and longitude associated to devices.
trans-unit.target: Real time location reporting allows to report the latitude and longitude associated to devices.

trans-unit.source: By default, this type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI), and the reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).
trans-unit.target: By default, this type of location reporting only uses network locations (based on Cell ID or WIFI), and the reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).

trans-unit.source: Real time locations are *NOT* used to compute statistics.
trans-unit.target: Real time locations are *NOT* used to compute statistics.

trans-unit.source: Their only purpose is to allow the use of real time
trans-unit.target: Their only purpose is to allow the use of real time

trans-unit.source: geo-fencing \<Reach-Audience-geofencing\> criterion in Reach campaigns.
trans-unit.target: geo-fencing \<Reach-Audience-geofencing\> criterion in Reach campaigns.

trans-unit.source: To enable real time location reporting, add the following line after initializing the Engagement agent:
trans-unit.target: To enable real time location reporting, add the following line after initializing the Engagement agent:

trans-unit.source: GPS based reporting
trans-unit.target: GPS based reporting

trans-unit.source: By default, real time location reporting only uses network based locations.
trans-unit.target: By default, real time location reporting only uses network based locations.

trans-unit.source: To enable the use of GPS based locations (which are far more precise), add:
trans-unit.target: To enable the use of GPS based locations (which are far more precise), add:

trans-unit.source: Background reporting
trans-unit.target: Background reporting

trans-unit.source: By default, real time location reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).
trans-unit.target: By default, real time location reporting is only active when the application runs in foreground (i.e. during a session).

trans-unit.source: To enable the reporting also in background, add:
trans-unit.target: To enable the reporting also in background, add:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When the application runs in background, only network based locations are reported, even if you enabled the GPS.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When the application runs in background, only network based locations are reported, even if you enabled the GPS.

trans-unit.source: Implementation of this function will call [startMonitoringSignificantLocationChanges] when your application goes into the background.
trans-unit.target: Implementation of this function will call [startMonitoringSignificantLocationChanges] when your application goes into the background.

trans-unit.source: Be aware that it will automatically relaunch your application into the background if a new location event arrives.
trans-unit.target: Be aware that it will automatically relaunch your application into the background if a new location event arrives.

trans-unit.source: Advanced reporting
trans-unit.target: Advanced reporting

trans-unit.source: Optionally, if you want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, you need to use the Engagement API through the methods of the `EngagementAgent` class.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, if you want to report application specific events, errors and jobs, you need to use the Engagement API through the methods of the `EngagementAgent` class.

trans-unit.source: An object of this class can be retrieved by calling the `[EngagementAgent shared]` static method.
trans-unit.target: An object of this class can be retrieved by calling the `[EngagementAgent shared]` static method.

trans-unit.source: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities and is detailed in the How to Use the
trans-unit.target: The Engagement API allows to use all of Engagement's advanced capabilities and is detailed in the How to Use the

trans-unit.source: Engagement API on iOS (as well as in the technical documentation of the `EngagementAgent` class).
trans-unit.target: Engagement API on iOS (as well as in the technical documentation of the `EngagementAgent` class).

trans-unit.source: Disable IDFA collection
trans-unit.target: Disable IDFA collection

trans-unit.source: By default, Engagement will use the [IDFA] to uniquely identify a user.
trans-unit.target: By default, Engagement will use the [IDFA] to uniquely identify a user.

trans-unit.source: But if you’re not using advertising elsewhere in the app, you might be rejected by the App Store review process.
trans-unit.target: But if you’re not using advertising elsewhere in the app, you might be rejected by the App Store review process.

trans-unit.source: IDFA collection can be disabled by adding the preprocessor macro `ENGAGEMENT_DISABLE_IDFA` in your pch file (or in the `Build Settings` of your application).
trans-unit.target: IDFA collection can be disabled by adding the preprocessor macro `ENGAGEMENT_DISABLE_IDFA` in your pch file (or in the `Build Settings` of your application).

trans-unit.source: This will ensure that there is no references to `ASIdentifierManager`, `advertisingIdentifier` or `isAdvertisingTrackingEnabled` in the application build.
trans-unit.target: This will ensure that there is no references to `ASIdentifierManager`, `advertisingIdentifier` or `isAdvertisingTrackingEnabled` in the application build.

trans-unit.source: Integration in the **prefix.pch** file:
trans-unit.target: Integration in the **prefix.pch** file:

trans-unit.source: You can verify that the IDFA collection is properly disabled in your application by checking the Engagement test logs.
trans-unit.target: You can verify that the IDFA collection is properly disabled in your application by checking the Engagement test logs.

trans-unit.source: See the Integration Test\<ios-sdk-engagement-test-idfa\> documentation for further information.
trans-unit.target: See the Integration Test\<ios-sdk-engagement-test-idfa\> documentation for further information.

trans-unit.source: This call is persistent: it uses `NSUserDefaults` to store the information.
trans-unit.target: This call is persistent: it uses `NSUserDefaults` to store the information.

trans-unit.source: You can enable log reporting again by calling the same function with `YES`.
trans-unit.target: You can enable log reporting again by calling the same function with `YES`.

trans-unit.source: Integration in your settings bundle
trans-unit.target: Integration in your settings bundle

trans-unit.source: Instead of calling this function, you can also integrate this setting directly in your existing `Settings.bundle` file.
trans-unit.target: Instead of calling this function, you can also integrate this setting directly in your existing `Settings.bundle` file.

trans-unit.source: The string `engagement_agent_enabled` must be used as a the preference identifier and it must be associated to a toggle switch(`PSToggleSwitchSpecifier`).
trans-unit.target: The string `engagement_agent_enabled` must be used as a the preference identifier and it must be associated to a toggle switch(`PSToggleSwitchSpecifier`).
